bug.author: patalanov
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Function not printing to browser after upgrade from 0.52.2 version to 0.57.3 <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
The following conditional works smoothly in 0.52.2 <denchmark-code>def prediction_of_deaths(df, notification_percentual, pred): if notification_percentual < 100: st.write('With the present notification value of ' + str(notification_percentual) + "%, we apply the global mortality rate of 3.5% of total cases.") st.markdown('[COVID-19 Global Mortality Rate](https://www.worldometers.info/coronavirus/coronavirus-death-rate/)') prediction_of_deaths_3_100 = pred*3.5/100 st.markdown("- Considering maximum death rate being around 3.5% of the total number of cases, we should expect ** " + str(int(round(prediction_of_deaths_3_100))) + "** deaths") </denchmark-code>
called at main() with: prediction_of_deaths(df, notification_percentual, pred) <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior: display st.markdown(), st.write()</denchmark-h>
But now with version 0.57.3, page stays blank when it reaches this point of code. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.57.3 Python version: 3.6.10 Heroku OS version: Mojave 10.14 Browser version: Chrome Version 80.0.3987.163 (Official Build) (64-bit)

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/patalanov>@patalanov</denchmark-link> , I'm not able to reproduce your issue. The following complete program works as expected for me in the latest version of Streamlit: <denchmark-code>import streamlit as st
def prediction_of_deaths(df, notification_percentual, pred): if notification_percentual < 100: st.write('With the present notification value of ' + str( notification_percentual) + "%, we apply the global mortality rate of 3.5% of total cases.") st.markdown( '[COVID-19 Global Mortality Rate](https://www.worldometers.info/coronavirus/coronavirus-death-rate/)') prediction_of_deaths_3_100 = pred * 3.5 / 100 st.markdown( "- Considering maximum death rate being around 3.5% of the total number of cases, we should expect ** " + str( int(round(prediction_of_deaths_3_100))) + "** deaths")
prediction_of_deaths(None, 1, 1) </denchmark-code>
Renders as: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/709022/80042172-2ac83e00-84b3-11ea-86d8-2519ed5639a1.png></denchmark-link>
Can you post a complete example showing the issue you're seeing?
